body:
In what could be considered a dream of the author put into paper. Therefore, the dream has to be considered not two dimensional but one and an half dimensional, having some properties of the truth of that universe, being two dimensional, while not managing to get past the unidimensional since the scene could only happen in one way, the one that the author intended, had she been completely different, the dream would play the same and, in conclusion, it actually did happen in a way that didn't happen.
1/10.

Day 50 - 1222*
Since this was all a dream can it be counted as having happened? This is quite the hard question to answer, on one hand, we have the fact that it didn't actually happen since a dream is, at most, a mirror of reality full of lies. On the other hand, since the actual sex was drawn, in that universe that did happen simce otherwise we would not be able to see the hentai part. Nevertheless, that can only mean one thing, it did in fact happen while not happening, while the world itself was two dimensional, the dream could be said as a projection of reality and therefore not totally true, while also maintaining a sense of being right, and therefore the sex became an half lie. Something that is true by being false. That means that the dream could be considered a reality since it needs to exist for it be a truth or a lie. However, if what she told was lie and she never had that dream, the sex would be only one quarter of the truth since she did in fact think of the intercourse...
